intro: Spartina polystachya, commonly known as salt marsh cordgrass, is a perennial grass native to the coastal regions of North America. It thrives in brackish and saline environments, often found in tidal marshes and estuaries. The plant has long, narrow leaves and produces dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Its extensive root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in coastal areas. Spartina polystachya plays a crucial role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various wildlife species.
